description: Primes p for which pi_{4,3}(p)-pi_{4,1}(p)=-1, where pi_{m,a}(x) is the number of primes <= x which are congruent to a (mod m).
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Quadratic Effect.
A. Granville and G. Martin, Prime number races, arXiv:0408319 [math.NT]
mathematica: For[i=2; d=0, True, i++, d+=Mod[p=Prime[i], 4]-2; If[d==-1, Print[p]]]
crossrefs: Cf. A156749 Sequence showing Chebyshev bias in prime races (mod 4). [From _Daniel Forgues_, Mar 26 2009]
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
